TITLE: Rishi Sunak to be Britain's new prime minister as rival Penny Mordaunt drops out
SUMMARY: Rishi Sunak will be named the U.K.'s new prime minister Monday, following a fast-tracked Conservative Party leadership race initiated to fill the void left by Liz Truss' resignation.

TITLE: Alibaba, Tencent shares plummet 11% alongside China tech stocks as Xi tightens grip on power
SUMMARY: Investors fear Chinese President Xi Jinping's tightened grip on power will lead to continued strict policies on the tech sector.

TITLE: Tesla shares down 3% in premarket after Elon Musk's EV firm cuts price of cars in China
SUMMARY: Tesla cut the price of its Model 3 and Model Y in China, partly reversing price hikes earlier in the year.

TITLE: Binance is ‘narrowing down’ identity of hacker behind $570 million crypto attack, CEO says
SUMMARY: After getting some tips from law enforcement, Binance is now “narrowing down” the hacker behind the attack, CEO Changpeng Zhao told CNBC Monday.

TITLE: Fears of a severe recession deepen as European business activity slows on surging energy costs
SUMMARY: European firms have been under pressure due to higher inflation, particularly coming from energy costs and wage pressures.

TITLE: JPMorgan president says a recession may be price to pay to beat inflation, market bottom not in yet
SUMMARY: JPMorgan Chase President Daniel Pinto shared his views on inflation, the U.S. economy and markets in an exclusive CNBC interview.

TITLE: Parenting expert: The No. 1 soft skill that predicts kids' success more than IQ—and how to teach it
SUMMARY: Studies show that kids who have perseverance are more likely to thrive than kids with high IQ scores. Child psychologist Michele Borba shares nine science-backed ways parents can teach their kids this valuable soft skill.

TITLE: This 53-year-old 'fish mongress' earns $200,000 a year: 'You just do what needs to be done'
SUMMARY: Laura Foley Ramsden has worked for her family's seafood company for nearly 40 years.

TITLE: China GDP beats with a bounce in the third quarter, delayed data shows
SUMMARY: The data reflected the impact of Covid controls and the real estate slump, while the automobile industry remained a bright spot.

TITLE: Almost half of the ultra-rich haven’t figured out how to pass on their wealth, research finds
SUMMARY: 41% of investors with more than $1 million worth of assets have not planned how they will pass on their wealth, a report by UBS found.

TITLE: China names Xi Jinping loyalists for core leadership group
SUMMARY: In remarks Sunday, Xi emphasized the Party's leadership in "a new journey to turn China into a modern socialist country," according to an official translation.

TITLE: China's leadership reshuffle puts greater weight on relations with the U.S.
SUMMARY: Foreign Minister Wang Yi joined the new Politburo, the second-highest level of power, state media announced Sunday.

TITLE: Former UK PM Boris Johnson pulls out of leadership race to replace Liz Truss
SUMMARY: Former U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson will not take part in the contest to replace outgoing leader Liz Truss.

TITLE: Economies in Asia have the tools to manage economic headwinds, U.S. deputy Treasury secretary says
SUMMARY: During the two-day APEC finance ministers' meeting, countries pledged not to adjust exchange rates for competitive purposes.

TITLE: Jan. 6 Capitol riot committee won't let Trump turn testimony into a 'circus,' Cheney says
SUMMARY: Committee Vice Chairwoman Liz Cheney, R-Wyo., said Trump will not be able to turn his testimony into a "circus."

TITLE: EU leaders give political backing to gas price cap — but details yet to be hammered out
SUMMARY: The EU moved one step closer to establishing a cap on gas prices after several months of discussions, with Germany now conceding that the idea "makes sense."

TITLE: 'Black Adam' tallies $67 million in domestic debut, first film opening since July to top $50 million
SUMMARY: Warner Bros.' latest DC Extended Universe film "Black Adam" tallied $67 million at the domestic box office during its opening weekend.

TITLE: Should you WFH or take a sick day? What to consider this cold, flu and Covid season
SUMMARY: From testing to monitoring symptoms to taking time off, what to do if you wake up feeling sick.

TITLE: The major space players and diverging strategies in the race to connect your smartphone via satellites
SUMMARY: The potential untapped is spurring a tale of two strategies. For some companies, it means billions spent on what could end up being a losing approach.

TITLE: How ethereum's merge made crypto mining more sustainable
SUMMARY: Ethereum, the world's second-largest cryptocurrency, recently reduced its energy consumption by 99.9%. But it's not likely that bitcoin will do the same.

TITLE: U.S. consumer is soldiering on despite soaring inflation and recession risk, credit card giants say
SUMMARY: American Express and Bank of America said U.S. consumers have demonstrated a willingness to continue to pay higher prices.

TITLE: Jan. 6 Capitol riot committee subpoenas former President Donald Trump
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump "personally orchestrated" efforts to reverse his loss to President Joe Biden, leaders of the Jan. 6 Capitol riot probe said.

TITLE: Formula 1 to create new all-female championship with 2023 debut possible
SUMMARY: The championship — which would be for younger drivers aged 16 to 22 — is planned to run alongside the similarly all-female W Series, Sky Sports reports.

TITLE: U.S. Defense secretary speaks with Russian counterpart as war in Ukraine enters ninth month
SUMMARY: The last known instance of the two leaders speaking was in May.

TITLE: This 37-year-old quit her job and now makes $10,000 a month in passive income: 'I wanted to be my own boss'
SUMMARY: After a layoff, Yo Quiero Dinero founder Jannese Torres was determined to be her own boss.  Today, she has 10 income streams that bring in $10,000 a month in passive income. Here's her best business advice.

TITLE: Asia's energy supply looks secure — even as Europe scrambles
SUMMARY: Unlike Europe which relies on gas for energy creation, gas makes up a much smaller portion of Asia's power mix.

TITLE: China-owned TikTok denies it could use location information to track U.S. users
SUMMARY: TikTok, owned by Chinese firm ByteDance, on Friday denied that it used specific location data to track certain U.S. individuals.

TITLE: Apple's top designer is leaving the company three years after taking over from Jony Ive
SUMMARY: Hankey took over for former Apple design chief Jony Ive three years ago and was responsible for much of Apple's industrial design work.

TITLE: Sanctions on Russia aluminum could send ripple effects through global supply chains
SUMMARY: Aluminum is the latest casualty of global economic headwinds as prices sink amid alleged dumping of Russian aluminum, weakening demand across the world including China and soaring operational costs.

TITLE: Elon Musk says a global recession could last until the spring of 2024
SUMMARY: Tesla founder Elon Musk thinks the global economic contraction can last for another year and a half.
